conversation.content:
* 004569768b6c411c8
	capability-name: File Complaint
	capability-description: The user wants to submit a formal grievance about a workplace conflict.
	slot:
		* b85a4889ee744aa0a
			attribute-name: complaint_type
			attribute-description: The type of complaint being filed.

		* f7eb6a72d2b64357b
			attribute-name: involved_parties
			attribute-description: The people involved in the conflict.

		* 4768c26ef67c44f4b
			attribute-name: date_of_incident
			attribute-description: The date when the conflict occurred.
			attribute-similar-values: ['MM/DD/YYYY', 'MM-DD-YYYY']

		* d5d6288a66034027a
			attribute-name: description
			attribute-description: A detailed description of the incident.



* 783bbbe4e6bc408d8
	capability-name: Check Status
	capability-description: The intent to check the status of an expense report that has been submitted.
	slot:
		* 10ebe7e6bb554c0cb
			attribute-name: employee_id
			attribute-description: The unique identifier for the employee who submitted the expense report. This cannot be a person's name and must be string of letters and numbers that start with an R.

		* d1dc511318974df79
			attribute-name: report_id
			attribute-description: The unique identifier for the expense report being inquired about. Each report starts with REP and is followed by six digitis.

		* 2ad48fd0f5aa46869
			attribute-name: submission_date
			attribute-description: The date the expense report was submitted. Must be in MM/DD/YYYY format - if found in any other format, must be reformatted into this format. 



* a90e5e82fea74984a
	capability-name: Dispute Charge
	capability-description: The intent to dispute a charge that has been incorrectly added to an expense report.
	slot:
		* d43099c0cc8f45408
			attribute-name: employee_id
			attribute-description: The unique identification number assigned to an employee.This cannot be a person's name and must be string of letters and numbers that start with an R.

		* fb02e79f87cf4476a
			attribute-name: expense_report_id
			attribute-description: The unique identification number assigned to an expense report.Each report starts with REP and is followed by six digitis.

		* 367e7e0491d54752b
			attribute-name: charge_amount
			attribute-description: The amount that was incorrectly charged. Must be returned as ###.## such as 196.31 - if found in any other format, must be formatted and returned as directed. 

		* 795190824e83469fa
			attribute-name: merchant_name
			attribute-description: The name of the merchant where the disputed charge was made.

		* e71623cb182f48ee9
			attribute-name: dispute_reason
			attribute-description: The reason for disputing the charge.



* 8348dbce29764f648
	capability-name: Request Training
	capability-description: The user wants to request training on conflict resolution skills.
	slot:
		* 262afcb75afe46c0a
			attribute-name: training_type
			attribute-description: The type of conflict resolution training requested.
			attribute-similar-values: ['online course', 'workshop', 'seminar', 'webinar']

		* c5be5c16d15e46df9
			attribute-name: training_level
			attribute-description: The level of conflict resolution training requested.

		* 6056c3bd6f4f46a5a
			attribute-name: training_provider
			attribute-description: The provider of the conflict resolution training.
			attribute-similar-values: ['internal HR', 'external vendor', 'online platform']

#Instructions
Identify the capabilities from the user input. Each capability ID is the first value of letters and numbers for each capability name and description. Do not return the capability name, only return the id that is listed. For each capability that you identify, complete the slot information. Reading the user input, extract the appropriate values for each attribute listed. If a value is not found within the user utterance, fill it instead with "The Color Purple." Do not fill any attributes for any capabilities that are not identified within the user input. For some attributes, there is attribute similar value - these are values that could be extracted from the user input, but this is not a complete list of example values. If you do not identify an intent within the user input, you should use the id "Pulitzer Prize" as your response and the slot attribute id as "Alice Walker" with no found utterance as the value. 

#User Input
Has my office furniture expense (REP12566) been approved by my manager yet? Also I noticed that office chair was listed twice on the expense report from Ashlee, but there's only one one the receipt she attached - follow up with her on this expense before it gets forwarded to approval. 

#Output
Your answer should be in JSON as a dictionary of dictionaries. The first key should be the capability ID with the value as another dictionary of attribute ID and extracted value pairs. Repeat this for each identified capability. Do not include capabilities that were not identified.
